docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: RECOGNIZING the public concern over the spread of AIDS, many Long Island school districts have adopted policies to regulate the admission of students and the employment of staff who have AIDS, AIDS-related complex (ARC) or confirmed presence of the HIV (human immuno-deficiency) antibody.

headline.main: AIDS in School: Districts Set Policy

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Sometime in the last school year, John R. Silber received a letter from a parent expressing anger that her daughter's roommate had lived for two months with a boyfriend in their dormitory at Boston University.

headline.main: Boston Journal; Campus Declares War To Control Dormitories

docs.snippet: LEAD: Sometime in the last school year, John R. Silber received a letter from a parent expressing anger that her daughter's roommate had lived for two months with a boyfriend in their dormitory at Boston University.
